items.title: [BUG] Unable to retrive all models information from model registry
items.body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for additional information about bug reports. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [*] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Debian 9
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: PIP
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.10.0
- **Python version**: 3.8

### Describe the problem
 Dear team,
Greetings!
I have my MLflow instance running in a docker container, I am using model registry and I use MinIo to remotely save my model the artifact and model logging works completely fine. I have issues retrieving the model information from model registry REST API.
For instance, I have a registry named "test" with 2 models V1 and V3.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44024922/90332105-72228f00-dfba-11ea-9fab-2f2d18eeb2ac.png)

When I use the API /api/2.0/preview/mlflow/registered-models/list to retrieve all the model information I always get only one model detail.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44024922/90332128-a7c77800-dfba-11ea-9a5a-d9775902a20c.png)

The document says all model with status READY is returned when the API is called, is there any way that I can get all the model information via the API?

Thank you very much.

items.title: License for MLflow icon
items.body:
Hey @gioa
Hope you are well.
I am using mlflow svg icon you [provided](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/1853) in my own application. I wanted to know if there is a license for this image. I opened up that[ zip ](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/files/3881869/MLflow-logo-set.zip)you provided and there's no license in there either. Without a license, I can't use the images, is there perhaps one on website or anything? (here's an example from github https://github.com/logos)

Please help me on this. Thanks!

Thank you for submitting a feature request. **Before proceeding, please review MLflow's [Issue Policy for feature requests](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md#feature-requests) and the [MLflow Contributing Guide](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst)**.

**Please fill in this feature request template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary

(In a few sentences, provide a clear, high-level description of the feature request)

## Motivation
- What is the use case for this feature?
- Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?
- Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization?
- Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? (please be as specific as possible about why related MLflow features and components are insufficient)

items.title: How to create logging from a custom mlflow.pyfunc.PythonModel from "mlflow models build-docker"

labels.name: area/docker
labels.description: Docker use anywhere, such as MLprojects and MLmodels

items.body:
Hi

Not sure were to ask this.

I have a custom mlflow.pyfunc.PythonModel model that I build into a docker container using mlflow models build-docker.  The problem I am encountering is how to get the logging into the container stdout.  Nothing appears.

When I use the model from a notebook 

```
artifact_path = mlflow.search_runs(order_by=["attributes.start_time DESC"])['artifact_uri'].iloc[0]
loaded_model  = mlflow.pyfunc.load_model(artifact_path + "/" + mlflow_pyfunc_model_path)
loaded_model.predict(...)
```

I get output.  I also get output when I use mlflow serve the output appears as well

My custom mlflow.pyfunc.PythonModel model

```
import logging

_logger = logging.getLogger("e ml")
_logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)

artifacts = {
    "embedded_model" : model_pickle_file,
}

class ModelWrapper(mlflow.pyfunc.PythonModel):

    def __init__(self, version):      
        self.version = version
        
    def load_context(self, context):
      
        import cloudpickle
        
        self.embedded_model = cloudpickle.load(open(context.artifacts['embedded_model'], 'rb'))
          
    def predict(self, context, model_input):
                        
        health_check = model_input.iloc[0][0]
        api_uuid     = model_input.iloc[0][1]
        env          = model_input.iloc[0][2]
        df           = model_input.drop(model_input.columns[[0,1,2]], axis=1)     
               
        if health_check.upper() == 'Y':
          
           # K8 health check
          
           _logger.info("K8 Health check found")
          
           return {'calling_api_uid' : api_uuid,
                    'Status'          : 'OK'}

        else:
          
           _logger.info("Starting api_uuid  - [%s]" % api_uuid)

           start_time       = datetime.datetime.now()

           predictions      = self.embedded_model.predict(df)

           end_time         = datetime.datetime.now()        
           time_diff        = end_time-start_time        
           output_time_diff = str(time_diff.seconds) + "." + str(time_diff.microseconds)

           _logger.info("Model Runtime Info - [%s][%s][%s][%s]" % (api_uuid, start_time.isoformat(), end_time.isoformat(), output_time_diff))

           return {                                                                                                                                                                                         }, 
                 "data"               : {"model_inputs"           : (df.values), 
                                         "model_prediction"       : predictions[0]
                                        }
                  }  
```

Any help would be much appreciated

Thanks

Bob

items.title: [BUG] Failed to load registered model from the FTP store

labels.name: priority/important-soon
labels.description: The issue is worked on by the community currently or will be very soon, ideally in time for the

items.body:
### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- I have written a small example that should be able to replicate the problem. The structure was taken from [issue 3197](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/3197#issuecomment-666116249)
- Ubuntu 18.04
- MLflow binary
- Mlflow version 1.10.0
- Pyhton version: 3.8

### Describe the problem
Loading a model with `model = mlflow.sklearn.load_model('models:/' + 'model-reg' + '/Staging')` should return the model.
Instead it throws an error.

```shell script
mlflow version: 1.10.0
tracking URI: http://XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX:5000/
artifact URI: ftp://mlflow:mlflow@XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX:2222/mlruns/721c37f3c87e4acdaea15b28029e4df8/artifacts
```

```shell script
Registered model 'model-reg' already exists. Creating a new version of this model...
Created version '6' of model 'model-reg'.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/monitoring/Projekt/MethodClasses/test/method_test/basic_ml_flow_test.py", line 52, in <module>
    test()
  File "/home/monitoring/Projekt/MethodClasses/test/method_test/basic_ml_flow_test.py", line 45, in test
    model = mlflow.sklearn.load_model('models:/' + 'model-reg' + '/Staging')
  File "/home/monitoring/.local/share/virtualenvs/MethodClasses-YeH10dls/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/sklearn.py", line 334, in load_model
    flavor_conf = _get_flavor_configuration(model_path=local_model_path, flavor_name=FLAVOR_NAME)
  File "/home/monitoring/.local/share/virtualenvs/MethodClasses-YeH10dls/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/model_utils.py", line 23, in _get_flavor_configuration
    raise MlflowException(
mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: Could not find an "MLmodel" configuration file at "/tmp/tmp42yolmhz/"

Process finished with exit code 1
```

The model was previously registered. It shows up in the web UI. The model is downloaded properly to a path in `/tmp/`.
The method in `mlflow.store.artifact.artifact_repo` returns the correct path to the files. E.g. `/tmp/tmp42yolmhz/model`. I manually checked the files MLmodel, conda.yml, model.pkl are inside the copied local dir `/tmp/tmp42yolmhz/model`.

In `mlflow.utils.model_utils` the function `_get_flavor_configuration` throws an exception, because it expects that model_path contains the files MLmodel, conda.yml, model.pkl, but model_path is `/tmp/tmp42yolmhz/ with contains only `model/` which then contains MLmodel, conda.yml, model.pkl.

### Code to reproduce issue
Hopefully this is a reproducible test case with the bare minimum necessary to replicate the problem.

Modified example from [issue 3197](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/3197#issuecomment-666116249).

FTP-Server:
```shell script
sudo docker run -d --name ftpd_server -p 2222:21 -p 30000-30009:30000-30009 -e "PUBLICHOST=XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX"     -e FTP_USER_NAME=mlflow -e FTP_USER_PASS=mlflow -e FTP_USER_HOME=/home/mlflow stilliard/pure-ftpd
```

```python
import pandas as pd

import string
import random

import mlflow
import mlflow.sklearn
from mlflow.tracking import MlflowClient

from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler


def test():
    mlflow.set_tracking_uri('http://XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX:5000/')

    def get_random_string(length):
        letters = string.ascii_lowercase
        return ''.join(random.choice(letters) for i in range(length))

    expr_name = get_random_string(32)
    artifact_location = "ftp://mlflow:mlflow@XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX:2222/mlruns"

    if mlflow.get_experiment_by_name(expr_name) is None:
        mlflow.create_experiment(expr_name, artifact_location)

    mlflow.set_experiment(expr_name)

    training_input = pd.DataFrame({'1': [1, 2, 3], '2': [4, 5, 6]})
    predict_input = pd.DataFrame({'1': [10, 20, 30], '2': [40, 50, 60]})

    with mlflow.start_run():
        print('mlflow version:', mlflow.__version__)
        print('tracking URI:', mlflow.get_tracking_uri())
        print('artifact URI:', mlflow.get_artifact_uri())

        scaler = StandardScaler()
        output = scaler.fit_transform(training_input)

        mlflow.sklearn.log_model(scaler, artifact_path='model',
                                 registered_model_name='model-reg')
        client = MlflowClient()
        version = client.get_registered_model('model-reg').latest_versions[0].version
        client.transition_model_version_stage('model-reg', version, 'Staging')

        model = mlflow.sklearn.load_model('models:/' + 'model-reg' + '/Staging')

        print(model)
        print(model.predict(predict_input))
```

### Other info / logs
Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks, please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached.

## Willingness to contribute

## Proposal Summary

- While we was working with mlflow we faced this issue, Not able to add description to models while registering. We don't want to add description to models or model versions after storing in database. We want while registering from API itself.

- Currently we are able to update/add description after registering models to model registry. 
- Currently we are able to do as below, but it would be help full if we can add description while registering itself. Please see below:
```
client = mlflow.tracking.MlflowClient()
client.update_registered_model(name="ElasticnetWineModel", description="Describing description for model")
client.update_model_version(name="ElasticnetWineModel", version=2, description="Describing description for model version")
```

## Motivation
- The reason we want describing the description while registering the model itself is, we are blocking users from updating data in database. We provided them only insert permission.

items.title: [FR] Add 'use_conda' parameter to MLflow projects backend plugin
items.body:
Thank you for submitting a feature request. **Before proceeding, please review MLflow's [Issue Policy for feature requests](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md#feature-requests) and the [MLflow Contributing Guide](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst)**.

## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary
The addition of 'use_conda' parameter in MLflow Project backend plugins would support end-to-end data science workflows for customers using a backend plugin for their project execution. It would allow them to test their conda environment and MLproject locally with the plugin before using compute resources for remote execution.

## Motivation
- What is the use case for this feature?
Data scientists can quickly test if their project works locally with their specified conda environment (either local or from mlproject) with their backend plugin before remote execution. 
- Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?
Adding use_conda would make it possible for a smooth, end-to-end experience for data scientists using a backend plugin for their training and execution. This would also save time and allow all artifacts and metrics from an experiment to be stored in the plugin's tracking store instead of in two locations. 
- Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization?
My project involves creating an AzureML integration with MLflow Projects. Adding this feature would support a full workflow experience for data scientists using AzureML for their backend service.
- Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? (please be as specific as possible about why related MLflow features and components are insufficient)
Currently use_conda is not passed to backend plugins, so there is no reliable way to infer in the plugin if a user wants to run their project with their local conda environment or the environment specified in MLproject.

I am using azuresql for tracking and azure blob for artifact. But i came across an issue while trying to create experiment/ run experiement. 

**Error :** 
ImportError: cannot import name 'RegisteredModelTag' from 'mlflow.entities.model_registry' (**/User\AppData\Local\Continuum\anaconda3\lib\site-packages\mlflow\entities\model_registry\__init__.py)

items.body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: yes
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: centos 7.4
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.9.0
- **Python version**: 3.7.3
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**: NA
- **Exact command to reproduce**:
- **S3 packages:** botocore 1.14.14, boto3 1.11.14

### Describe the problem
My mlflow server runs on centos with **Postgresql backend storage** and **S3 (minio) artifact storage**:
`mlflow server --backend-store-uri postgresql://<pg-location-and-credentials> --default-artifact-root s3://mlflow -h 0.0.0.0 -p 8000`
I set all S3 relevant env vars:
MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL, AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_DEFAULT_REGION
I've **successfully** ran several runs from other machine against this server:

- Runs all finished OK, with params, metrics and artifacts.

- Postrgesql mlflow tabels were updated accordingly.

- All arifacts were stored in minio bucket as expected and I can display and download them by minio browser.

However, when I select any artifact in the UI, I get **Internal Server Error** in the browser.
### Other info / logs
In the mlflow server I see the following error:
```
ERROR mlflow.server: Exception on /get-artifact [GET]
# I skip most of the traceback
File "<python-path>/site-packages/mlflow/serverhandlers.py": line 180, in get_artifact_handler
    return send_file(filename, mimetype='text/plain', as_attachment=True)
File "<python-path>/site-packages/flask/helpers.py", line 629, in send_file
    file = open(filename, "rb")
IsADirectoryError: [Error 21] Is a directory: '/tmp/<generated-name>/<my-file>'
```
**Actually, there is a '/tmp/\<generated-name>/<my-file>' which is really a directory and not a file!
This folder contains another directory with a generated name, and inside there's nothing!**
I didn't find any similar error regarding mlflow and s3.
What's wrong?

The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [X] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary
Ability to view deleted experiments in the MLflow UI. Similar to how runs are viewed, the ability to view deleted experiments, rename them, and restore them in the UI (potentially by adding an option to change the view) might be a useful feature.

## Motivation
- What is the use case for this feature?
For current MLflow UI users, experiments can be deleted but once deleted, they can not be seen/restore/renamed. Adding this feature would allow these actions to be done from within the MLflow UI.

- Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?
This will allow all MLflow users to maintain/organize experiments from within the UI, and recover old/archived experiments. It will also make the overall experiment lifecycle more visible.

- Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization?
My project involves Azure ML integration with Mlflow, including the UI - in Azure, only deleted/archived experiments can be renamed, and they can also be viewed/restored, so this feature would allow for greater parity between the two.

- Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? (please be as specific as possible about why related MLflow features and components are insufficient)
I believe MLflow is just missing UI components to view deleted experiments by changing a view type, and restore and rename said deleted experiments

items.body:
### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [x] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows 10
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: Binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.9.1
- **Python version**: 3.6
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**:

### Describe the problem

MLFlow packages do not specify an MLFlow version in the produced conda.yaml: 

e.g.
```yaml
channels:
- defaults
- conda-forge
dependencies:
- python=3.7.7
- fastai=1.0.61
- pip
- pip:
  - mlflow
name: mlflow-env
```

This may be an intentional feature rather than a _bug_, but it strikes me as a bit odd to assume a package produced from one version of mlflow will work with a newer version? 

Is there some rationale of compatibility here, or should the ability to specify the mlflow version when saving a model by added?

items.title: [FR] Add pip native support
items.body:
## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [X] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [X] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary

The actual version of mlflow is heavily dependent on conda package, on the other hand the use of the default pip package is widely used by the community. Therefore, the native support to pip will encourage a lot of users that do not use the conda package to start using mlflow.

## Motivation
- What is the use case for this feature? Use of mlflow without needing to use conda environments.
- Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general? It will allow to non-conda users to use features from mlflow without workarounds (like serve models).
- Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization? It will become a standard to use mlflow since we do not use conda.
- Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? The user needs to install manually all the packages from a requirements.txt file, this process can be automated with the proposed feature.

### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this feature affect?
Components 
- [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code

- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients

Integrations
- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations

## Details

The proposed feature request can be done by adding a new flag on MLproject files indicating the filename which contains all packages and their versions (pip freeze output). Then the mlflow can install those packages in the current environment, or create a local environment.

items.title: [FR] Atomic Chained Stage Transitioning

labels.name: area/model-registry
labels.description: Model registry, model registry APIs, and the fluent client calls for model registry

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: UIUX Front-end, user experience, javascript, plotting

labels.name: priority/important-soon
labels.description: The issue is worked on by the community currently or will be very soon, ideally in time for the

items.body:
## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [X] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary

Allow for atomic stage transitions for multiple versions (ideally in the GUI along with programmatically). For example, transition v2 from Staging to Production and v1 from Production to Archived as a single transaction. The issue this is working around is a requirement that only a single model be deployed to an environment at a time. If more than 1 is in any stage, additional logic is required to ascertain which one is to be used.

## Motivation
- What is the use case for this feature? A model deployment environment which requires a single model to be the model that is used for that environment. If a query to determine which model is in a stage happens to occur while the user is transitioning models (i.e. 0 or 2 in a stage), then it's ambiguous as to which model (if any) should be utilized)
- Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general? If MLflow is to become the "truth" for ML models, it needs to support the use of registered models by production systems. This FR allows a simplification of the logic to determine which model should be used in various deployment environments.
- Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization? We currently have added logic to address the more than 1 model case (chose the latest version number) and require the person executing the deployment in MLflow to promote the new model first before promoting (or Archiving) the existing model. This works fine, but an atomic solution would be cleaner.
- Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? I wouldn't call it difficult, but it's less than optimal. See above.

```python
import pandas as pd

# works
```

items.title: [BUG] `mlflow.search_runs` does not raise error or warning when passed invalid `order_by` expression

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

items.body:
`mlflow.search_runs` does not raise error or warning when passed invalid `order_by` expression. I think this behavior is dangerous. Let's consider a scenario where a user wants to select the best model from a bunch of runs and writes the code below:

```python
order_by = ["metrics.accuracy DECS"]  # "DECS" is a typo, should be "DESC"
sorted_runs = mlflow.search_runs(..., order_by=order_by)
best_run = sorted_runs.iloc[0]  # select the frist row
best_model = load_model_from_run(best_run)
```

What this code does is:
- The `order_by` expression `"metrics.accuracy DECS"` doesn't end with ` desc` or ` asc` so it's parsed as a metric named `accuracy DECS`.
- `search_runs` sorts runs by the metric `accuracy DECS` which doesn't exist and returns unsorted runs.
- `sorted_runs.iloc[0]` is obviously not the best run, **but no error or warning is raised**.

items.title: [BUG] Higher-order function causes crash when pickling MlFlowClient
items.body:
### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [x] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
I'm running on MLFlow installed from PyPi, but more relevant env info can be found below:

```
Linux Pop!_OS 20.04
Python 3.6.10 :: Anaconda, Inc.

mlflow==1.8.0
pytorch-lightning==0.7.6
torch==1.5.0
torchvision==0.2.1
```

### Describe the problem
This problem arises when pickling `MlFlowClient` objects and results in a pickling error due to the use of a higher order function within `mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/utils.py` in the `_get_rest_store(store_uri, **_)` function. There are other implementations of pickle that can handle lambda/higher order functions (e.g. Dill, CloudPickle), but  Python's built-in pickle library can not handle these methods. 

This becomes _extremely_ problematic when using MLFlow in conjunction with 3rd party packages. One such example is Pytorch-Lightning, where they have implemented a [wrapper](https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/issues/630) for the MlFlowClient that ends up getting pickled during distributed applications (specifically using the DistributedDataParallel or `DDP` torch backend).

### Code to reproduce issue
A minimal example for reproducing this issue that mirrors how Pytorch-Lightning configured their wrapper can be found in this [gist](https://gist.github.com/Polyphenolx/1b3970fe10ba70748204cd45b0f75139). Of course, wrapping the `MlFlowClient` is completely unnecessary for the reproduction of this bug- simply pickle and `MlFlowClient` object.

### Other info / logs
```
>> python mlflow_pickle_error.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "mlflow_test.py", line 14, in <module>
    pickle.dump(cls, open('test_dump.pkl', 'wb'))
AttributeError: Can't pickle local object '_get_rest_store.<locals>.get_default_host_creds'
```

### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for
Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: Local serving, model deployment tools, spark UDFs
- [x] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interface 
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, JavaScript, plotting
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

Language 
- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients

Integrations
- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations

### Proposed Solution

The pickle issue can be resolved by modifying `_get_rest_store` and removing/renaming the higher-order function, and using a partial to wrap the function call (Note: This requires adding `from functools import partial`). After making the changes below, the gist can run without issue. I'd be more than happy to open a PR and follow the proper protocols to contribute this fix if it is deemed acceptable.

```
def _get_default_host_creds(store_uri):
    return rest_utils.MlflowHostCreds(
        host=store_uri,
        username=os.environ.get(_TRACKING_USERNAME_ENV_VAR),
        password=os.environ.get(_TRACKING_PASSWORD_ENV_VAR),
        token=os.environ.get(_TRACKING_TOKEN_ENV_VAR),
        ignore_tls_verification=os.environ.get(_TRACKING_INSECURE_TLS_ENV_VAR) == 'true',
        client_cert_path=os.environ.get(_TRACKING_CLIENT_CERT_PATH_ENV_VAR),
        server_cert_path=os.environ.get(_TRACKING_SERVER_CERT_PATH_ENV_VAR),
    )

def _get_rest_store(store_uri, **_):
    return RestStore(partial(_get_default_host_creds, store_uri))
```

#### Output After Implementing Proposed Solution

```
>> python mlflow_pickle_error.py

Process finished with exit code 0
```

items.title: [FR] Configurable SQLAlchemy Engine Options
items.body:
## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary
Allow higher configurability of the SQLAlchemy engine. [SQLAlchemy Engines](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/core/engines.html) provide various configuration options which can be passed in during engine creation to `sqlalchemy.create_engine`. Have a system for SQLAlchemy Engine parameters to be configured at runtime.

## Motivation
- What is the use case for this feature?
SQLAlchemy configuration options can be used by users to optimize database access based on the database being used. 

- Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?
This can allow users to configure SQLAlchemy to their requirements without modifying the [engine creation code](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/store/db/utils.py#L175). The user can configure custom `connect_args`, Pooling options (beyond `pool_size` and `pool_overflow`), etc as defined in the [SQLAlchemy Documentation](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/core/engines.html).

- Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization?
My specific use case is to use MLFlow Server with AWS Serverless DB, in which short-lived connections are preferred over persistent connections, as produced by the default SQLAlchemy Pooling strategy. Pooling can be disabled by passing the `sqlalchemy.pool.NullPool` during engine creation, but this is not possible because of the [hardcoded configuration](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/store/db/utils.py#L175) (barring the options for `pool_size` and `pool_overflow`).

- Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? (please be as specific as possible about why related MLflow features and components are insufficient)
The [configuration](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/store/db/utils.py#L175) is hardcoded currently, except for configuring the `pool_size` and `pool_overflow` parameters. While this is helpful, it is limiting. Parameters like `poolclass`, `connect_args`, `pool_timeout` cannot be configured easily without changing the codebase.

### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this feature affect?
Components 
- [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [x] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for
Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: Local serving, model deployment tools, spark UDFs
- [x] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interfaces
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, JavaScript, plotting
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [x] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

Languages 
- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients

Integrations
- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations

## Details
Instead of having hardcoded environment variables for two parameters, all environment variables of the format `MLFLOW_SQLALCHEMYSTORE_*` could be read and passed in as kwargs to `sqlalchemy.create_engine`.

An issue here could be when classes have to be passed to the engine, like `poolclass=sqlalchemy.pool.NullPool`. An alternative solution could be to employ the `sqlalchemy.engine_from_config` method for engine creation.

items.title: [FR] Run Docker with -t argument

labels.name: area/docker
labels.description: Docker use anywhere, such as MLprojects and MLmodels

items.body:
**Please fill in this feature request template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

## Willingness to contribute

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [X] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary

Please enable the -t flag for docker run.

## Motivation
To enable colored output inside a run Docker container I need the `-t` flag. This requires a tty.

Colored output is very helpful to discern status and error messages when training models.

items.title: [FR] - changing the default value of artifact_location to try reading it from the environment variable

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

items.body:
Thank you for submitting a feature request. **Before proceeding, please review MLflow's [Issue Policy for feature requests](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md#feature-requests) and the [MLflow Contributing Guide](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst)**.

**Please fill in this feature request template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [x] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary
Currently, the create_experiment method uses artifact_location=None as a default argument. It would be better if by default the system tried to read the value for MLFLOW_ARTIFACT_URI from the environment and uses none if that is not found.

basically just replace :
def create_experiment(name, artifact_location=os.environ['MLFLOW_ARTIFACT_URI']):

by this
def create_experiment(name, artifact_location=os.getenv('MLFLOW_ARTIFACT_URI', None)):

(In a few sentences, provide a clear, high-level description of the feature request)

## Motivation
- What is the use case for this feature? - Instead of having None as the default value for artifact URI, and then user having to remember where they want their data to be saved and pass it in - it would be easier if the value was read from the environment and None only be used if the corresponding var is not found.

- Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?
We might have a default artifact uri - where all your final artifacts should be saved. In this case, we either set the environment variable or can pass it in. By default, the variable is None right now, in which case it doesn't read from the environment but creates an artifact folder in the current working direction/mlruns. However, many-a-times, especially if the artifact uri is an s3 bucket - its hard to remember the exact path. If the value is read by default, it will be one less thing to worry about the boilerplate - especially for new users. 

- Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization? We have set out artifact_uri to be s3 bucket. It is hard to pass or remember to pass the artifact_uri every time an experiment is created, especially by users not familiar to mlflow

- Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? (please be as specific as possible about why related MLflow features and components are insufficient) - It is not difficult to fix it. Currently, we have patches for this. But would be more convenient if it was there in mlflow - since it would remove the need for unnecessary patches.

Components

items.title: [FR] Set content type and encoding on logged artifacts (s3)

labels.name: Acknowledged
labels.description: This issue has been read and acknowledged by the MLflow admins.

items.body:
## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary
Allow content metadata to be set (by caller) by log_artifact calls for the S3ArtifactRepository, and guess the type if not given.

## Motivation
Currently, all artifacts are treated as binary/octet-stream in s3. This means our browsers are unable to help view the artifacts even if they are eg. images, or text files, or other files they can display nicely -- they will always just download. This applies to pre-signed urls generated for these objects, so generally including these in any web interfaces leads to a poor user experience. 

### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this feature affect?
Components 
- [x] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging

Interfaces
- [x] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, JavaScript, plotting
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

Languages 
- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients

Integrations
- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations

## Details
There is a relatively simple solution if we only want to tackle s3, but there are potential design considerations if this would be extended beyond s3, so I would like some input before opening a PR. One approach to this would be:

1. Extend log_artifact signature to allow extra, optional kwargs: content_type, content_encoding.
2. If given, respect the given values, and set these in the ExtraArgs dict: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/18eacdd9bde4e693942ff94882fb3da322b593c0/mlflow/store/artifact/s3_artifact_repo.py#L53-L57

We would merge these values with those given by `get_s3_file_upload_extra_args()`. 

3. If not given, use stdlib `mimetypes.guess_type` to guess these values, and set them:

```
content_type, content_encoding = guess_type(local_file)
if content_type is not None:
    extra_args['ContentType'] = content_type
if content_encoding is not None:
    extra_args['ContentEncoding'] = content_encoding
```

The open questions are:

- Is this change the log_artifact signature acceptable?
- Can the behaviour be to always guess the content type (awscli does this for cp command)?
- Would adding this to s3 necessitate doing so for other artifact repository types?

- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: no
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux Debian Buster
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: source
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.8.0
- **Python version**: 3.8
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**: `mlflow server --backend-store-uri postgresql://username:password@host:port/name`

### Describe the problem
The first time an mlflow server is started, tables are created and the database is updated to prepare it for use. This triggers this line: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/8e6b27dbc3370d9fc0e550d6bbaf00a7b7feb0be/mlflow/store/db/utils.py#L124

Unfortunately, this means the log output contains the full text of the engine.url, including the database username and password, which is secret information and shouldn't appear in plaintext log files. 

Expected behaviour: sensitive information should either be masked or excluded.

I traced into sqlalchemy code and found that the URL object contained within the engine behaves differently when str() or repr()'ed: https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/blob/3ab5e3781b9f44d458cb6213e89f50d01ea167dd/lib/sqlalchemy/engine/url.py#L105-L109

With str-formatting, it does not hide passwords, whereas with repr it does.

I'm happy to contribute a fix, of which I see a few options:

- Drop including the url in this log statement
- Move the url to a debug statement
- Use repr instead of str for formatting


### Code to reproduce issue
Create an server backed by a SQL database using `mlflow server --backend-store-uri <uri>`, observe the log output: "Updating database tables at <postgresql://user:password@host:port/name>"

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

items.body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for additional information about bug reports. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.8.0
- **Python version**: 3.6.10
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**: NA
- **Exact command to reproduce**: mlflow.tensorflow.autolog() with early stopping callback to model.fit(); and set "restore_best_weights" = True

### Describe the problem
When using an early stopping callback with `restore_best_weights=True`, autolog() erroneously assumes early stopping has happened even if training proceeds till last epoch. It computes `restored_epoch = stopped_epoch - max(1, patience)` which produces incorrect epoch number if there was no early stopping. There should be an additional check to see if `stopped_epoch != n_epochs`, to ensure early stopping has happened. 
This has the side effect of flipping metric plot in mlflow UI, putting an older metric value at a higher step value, giving the impression of increasing loss or decreasing accuracy.

### Code to reproduce issue
Any tf.keras.Model code(v2.1 or higher), with this callback added to `model.fit()` 
```
tf.keras.callbacks.EarlyStopping(monitor='val_loss',
                                                       min_delta=0.01,
                                                       patience=2,
                                                       verbose=0,
                                                       mode='auto',
                                                       baseline=None,
                                                       restore_best_weights=True
                                                       )
```

Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks, please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached.

def _dbfs_path_exists(self, dbfs_path):
    """
    Return True if the passed-in path exists in DBFS for the workspace corresponding to the
    default Databricks CLI profile. The path is expected to be a relative path to the DBFS root
    directory, e.g. 'path/to/file'.
    """
    host_creds = databricks_utils.get_databricks_host_creds(self.databricks_profile)
    response = rest_utils.http_request(
        host_creds=host_creds, endpoint="/api/2.0/dbfs/get-status", method="GET",
        json={"path": "/%s" % dbfs_path})


def jobs_runs_get(self, databricks_run_id):
    response = self._databricks_api_request(
        endpoint="/api/2.0/jobs/runs/get", method="GET", json={"run_id": databricks_run_id})
    return json.loads(response.text)

items.body: Thank you for submitting a feature request. **Before proceeding, please review MLflow's [Issue Policy for feature requests](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md#feature-requests) and the [MLflow Contributing Guide](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst)**. **Please fill in this feature request template to ensure a timely and thorough response.** ## Willingness to contribute The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)? - [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently. - [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community. - [x] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time. ## Proposal Summary The experiment list sidebar is fixed width and truncates long experiment names, making it difficult to sift through. It would be nice to be able to have a resizable sidebar which I could use to look through my experiments easier ## Motivation - What is the use case for this feature? Allows for longer experiment names to be practical. Enables prefixing experiment names with things like username, issue numbers, architecture, and other meta-information. - Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general? Allows users to have more freedom in how they choose to name experiments. - Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization? I would like to prefix my experiment names and currently that would make them too long to appear nicely in the UI. - Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? (please be as specific as possible about why related MLflow features and components are insufficient) If I have many experiments which are named "\/\/\" then they will appear truncated in the UI and I am unable to see the descriptive part of the name. Hovering over many of these would be cumbersome to finding the one I want. Additionally, I cannot easily set or search through experiment tags in the UI, so the name is the only place to store information about an experiment. ### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this feature affect? Components - [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging - [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow - [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages - [ ] `area/examples`: Example code - [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry - [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors - [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends - [ ] `area/scoring`: Local serving, model deployment tools, spark UDFs - [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging Interfaces - [x] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, JavaScript, plotting - [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models - [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry - [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support Languages - [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients - [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients Integrations - [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations - [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations ## Details (Use this section to include any additional information about the feature. If you have a proposal for how to implement this feature, please include it here. For implementation guidelines, please refer to the [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst#contribution-guidelines).)


items.body:
### Willingness to contribute

- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No 
- **OS Platform and Distribution**: Debian GNU/Linux 10 (buster)

- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: mlflow, version 1.0.0
- **Python version**:  Python 3.6.10
- **Exact command to reproduce**:
```sql
MySQL [db]> INSERT INTO `params` (`key`, `value`, `run_uuid`) VALUES ( 'preprocessor', 'HtmlStrip >> EmailTitleCleaner >> SuperImportantTokenizer >> DateTokenizer >> MonthTokenizer >> TimeTokenizer >> EmailTokenizer >> MoneyTokenizer >> YARNTokenizer >> SecureUrlTokenizer >> SomeDnsTokenizer >> UrlTokenizer >> TicketIdTokenizer >> IpTokenizer >> PhoneTokenizer >> NumberTokenizer >> RegexTokenizer >> RegexTokenizer >> SurplusSpacesCleaner', 'd4459fec14dd4e5a8655e69cefe9ae74' );
ERROR 1406 (22001): Data too long for column 'value' at row 1
```
### Describe the problem
I am using the following code https://gist.github.com/bnekolny/8ec96faa0d57913eea6bb7848c06b912 to import from file-based backend store to mysql database 

I found that default schema creates all string fields as [varchar(250) (latest_schema.sql#L104)](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/resources/db/latest_schema.sql#L104) while **YAML has no such restriction, or I am wrong?**
Also, I can't find any mentioning that there is such restriction (250 max characters) at https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#concepts

I can perform the schema change:
```sql 
ALTER TABLE `params` MODIFY value VARCHAR(512) NOT NULL;
```
But what will be the side effect?

### Code to reproduce issue
value field has `varchar(250)`

```sql
MySQL [db]> SHOW CREATE TABLE params\G
*************************** 1. row ***************************
       Table: params
Create Table: CREATE TABLE `params` (
  `key` varchar(250) NOT NULL,
  `value` varchar(250) NOT NULL,
  `run_uuid` varchar(32) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY (`key`,`run_uuid`),
  KEY `run_uuid` (`run_uuid`),
  CONSTRAINT `params_ibfk_1` FOREIGN KEY (`run_uuid`) REFERENCES `runs` (`run_uuid`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1
1 row in set (0.001 sec)
```
